hypotheses: Environmental factors such as temperature and precipitation influence COVID-19 spread.
Economic openness increases the spread of COVID-19.
Social factors, including political democracy, affect COVID-19 case numbers.
claim.statement: The study investigates the factors influencing the uneven spread of COVID-19 across countries, noting correlations with environmental, economic, and social factors such as temperature, economic openness, and political democracy.

data.source: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), meteoblue.com, indexmundi.com, World Bank Databank, Wikipedia
data.wave_or_subset: Data from December 31, 2019, to April 3, 2020, covering 163 countries
data.notes: Precipitation and population density were initially included but later excluded due to insignificance in results.

method.description: Regression models were used to study determinants of COVID-19 spread with the number of cases per one million as the dependent variable. Explanatory variables included environmental, economic, and social factors with models addressing lagged effects and multicollinearity.
steps: Data collection from specified sources for 163 countries.
Initial regression models developed using key variables.
Refinement of models by excluding insignificant variables.
Incorporation of lagged variables to study temporal effects.
Statistical analysis using software tools such as Excel, STATA, and EVIEWS.
method.models: Least Squares regression with lagged variable analysis.
method.outcome_variable: Total number of infection cases per one million people
method.independent_variables: Yearly average temperature, economic openness, democracy index, population density

results.summary: The study found correlations between COVID-19 cases and lower temperatures, higher economic openness, and stronger political democracy, suggesting these factors influence infection rates across countries.

numerical_results.direction: Correlations were noted to be positive for economic openness and democracy, and negative for temperature.
